title: Did Congress fire 14 members to support the Confederation, not recognizing Lincoln as president?
subtitle: There is a date for the expulsion of members of the House of Representatives and the Senate, but were the reasons similar to the political events of 2020?
author: Dan MacGuill
vclaim: In 1861, three members of the United States House of Representatives and 11 members of the Senate were expelled for their support of the Confederation and for failing to recognize Abraham Lincoln's election as President.
